qas.question: Who introduced the first major model for communication in 1949?
What did the first model for communication consist of?
What was the sender in the initial model?

answers.text: the part of a telephone a person spoke into

qas.question: What was the channel in the initial model?
What was the receiver in the initial model?

answers.text: the part of the phone where one could hear the other person

qas.question: In 1945 the first communication model was introduced for what company?
What had two primary parts of a sender and a receiver?
The channel was where one could hear what?
Shannon and Bell recognized that what interfered with listening to a telephone conversation?
Warren Shannon and Claude Weaver worked for whom?

context: The first major model for communication was introduced by <a0_0>Claude Shannon and Warren Weaver<a0_0/> for <b5_0><b9_0>Bell Laboratories<b9_0/><b5_0/> in 1949 The original model was designed to mirror the functioning of radio and telephone technologies. Their <b6_0>initial model<b6_0/> consisted of three primary parts: <a1_0>sender, channel, and receiver<a1_0/>. The sender was <a2_0>the part of a telephone a person spoke into<a2_0/>, the channel was <a3_0>the telephone itself<a3_0/>, and the receiver was <a4_0>the part of the phone where one could hear <b7_0>the other person<b7_0/><a4_0/>. Shannon and Weaver also recognized that often there is <b8_0>static<b8_0/> that interferes with one listening to a telephone conversation, which they deemed noise.
